title: Getting Started with finsyncR
text: finsyncR (fish invertebrate synchronizer R) R package flexibly acquires, processes, integrates national-level fish macroinvertebrate datasets collected rivers streams US. sources data package United States Environmental Protection Agency‚Äôs (EPA) National Aquatic Resource Surveys (NARS), namely National River Streams Assessment (NRSA), United States Geological Survey‚Äôs (USGS) BioData. package provides standardized abundance occurrence data fish density occurrence data macroinvertebrates variety levels taxonomic resolution. package can also match sampling sites land cover data. package reduces barriers data use providing flexible solutions barriers. Barriers summarized briefly . Please see associated manuscript describes barriers addressed detail broader framework package. Getting Started Vignette, provide -guide using package (see Table 1 example code). Table 1. Example code generate macroinvertebrates fish datasets given hypothetical research questions.

text: one function generates land cover data, getNLCDData(). getNLCDData() retrieves land cover data Multi-Resolution Land Characteristics Consortium‚Äôs National Land Cover Database (NLCD) sampling sites catchment watershed scales. function directly accesses EPA StreamCat API (Hill et al.¬†2015) gather NLCD data based sampling location NHDPlus COMIDs collection year. getNLCDData() matches sampling sites NLCD data time. Users can specify whether NLCD data extracted catchment Cat watershed Ws scales. Catchments portion landscape surface flow drains COMID stream segment, excluding upstream contributions. Watersheds set hydrologically connected catchments, consisting upstream catchments contribute flow catchment. See StreamCat documentation information. NLCD data can grouped five broad categories using group = TRUE. categories include ‚Äúwater‚Äù (grouping wetland open water land covers), ‚Äúurban‚Äù (grouping urban land use), ‚Äúforest‚Äù (grouping deciduous, coniferous, mixed forests land covers), ‚Äúopen‚Äù (grouping shrub, barren land, grassland, hay/pasture land covers), ‚Äúcrop‚Äù (cultivated crop land use).

title: Access and harmonize fish data ‚Äî getFishData
text: dataType Output data type community matrix, either "abun" (abundance) "occur" (occurrence). taxonLevel Level taxonomic resolution community matrix. Input must one : "Family", "Genus", "Species". agency agency name names (e.g., "USGS" "EPA") source data output community matrix. See Details information. standardize Standardization method used calculating fish abundance matrices. Default standardize = "none", returns raw fish count values. options include standardize = "CPUE", returns standardized abundances Catch per Unit Effort. alternative standardization method standardize = "MGMS", uses Multigear Mean Standardization (MGMS) values account catchability differences fish sampling methods. See 'Details' information standardizations. hybrids logical. hybrid individuals included output dataset? TRUE FALSE. sharedTaxa logical. taxa limited organisms appear EPA USGS datasets? TRUE FALSE. Must set FALSE one agency specified. boatableStreams logical. EPA boatable streams included output dataset? TRUE FALSE. Note: USGS fish samples wadable streams. advisable include boatable streams building dataset including EPA USGS data. Boatable EPA data wadeable USGS data necessarily comparable.

title: Match data from the National Land Cover Database to each fish and macroinvertebrate sampling site ‚Äî getNLCDData
text: Land-use/land-cover data extracted Multi-Resolution Land Characteristics (MRLC) Consortium National Land Cover Database (NLCD). LULC data available following years: 2001, 2004, 2006, 2008, 2011, 2013, 2016, 2019. years input data exact year matches list, years matched closest year NLCD data (e.g. site sampled 1995 NLCD data 2001). Note samples fall midpoint two NLCD years (e.g. 2005), function defaults earlier year (e.g. site sampled 2005 NLCD data 2004). Data can extracted catchment ("Cat") watershed ("Ws") scales. catchment includes land area drains directly sampled stream segment medium-resolution National Hydrography Dataset version 2.(NHDPlusV2), excludes data upstream segments. watershed scale includes data local catchment upstream contributing catchments. NLCD data can grouped (group = TRUE) five broad categories. categories include "water" (grouping wetland open water land covers), "urban" (grouping urban land covers), "forest" (grouping deciduous, coniferous, mixed forests), "open" (grouping shrub, barren land, grassland, hay/pasture), "crop" (grouping, just crop land use). function gathers catchment/watershed NLCD data StreamCat database (Hill et al. 2016) via StreamCat API (https://www.epa.gov/national-aquatic-resource-surveys/streamcat-metrics-rest-api).

title: Match data from the National Land Cover Database to each fish and macroinvertebrate sampling site ‚Äî getNLCDData
text: Hill, Ryan ., Marc H. Weber, Scott G. Leibowitz, Anthony R. Olsen, Darren J. Thornbrugh, 2016. Stream-Catchment (StreamCat) Dataset: Database Watershed Metrics Conterminous United States. Journal American Water Resources Association (JAWRA) 52:120-128. DOI: 10.1111/1752-1688.12372.

title: Match data from the National Land Cover Database to each fish and macroinvertebrate sampling site ‚Äî getNLCDData

title: Match data from the National Land Cover Database to each fish and macroinvertebrate sampling site ‚Äî getNLCDData
code: if (FALSE) { ## Code to generate the percent land-use/land-cover in the catchment for ## site numbers "USGS-05276005" and "USGS-01390450" from 2007 2008, respectively.    dat = data.frame(SiteNumber = c("USGS-05276005","USGS-01390450"),                    CollectionYear = c(2007,2008))    getNLCDData(data=dat,   scale = "Cat",   group = FALSE)  ## Code to generate the percent land-use/land-cover in the catchment for ## all samples in the base macroinvertebrate dataset, and grouping those ## LULC data into broad categories.    invertDat1 <- getInvertData()   invertDat1_forNLCD <- invertDat1 %>%     dplyr::select(SiteNumber, CollectionYear)     dat1 = data.frame(invertDat1_forNLCD)    getNLCDData(data=dat1,   scale = "Cat",   group = TRUE)   }
